summary: The School Resource Officer Reform Act amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exclude compensation for qualified school resource officers from gross income and amends the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 to make school resource officers eligible for public safety officer death benefits. Specifically, it defines "qualified school resource officer" as a retired peace officer employed as an armed SRO at an elementary or secondary school. It also makes corresponding changes to payroll tax and wage withholding rules.
